attributes.action: Prevent shops from selling or advertising Christmas product until advent starts.
attributes.background: Christmas is a special time of year for children, however, the magic is being diluted due to trade and commerce. It is August 2018 and already there are Christmas products on display in shops in the UK. This is absurd. Christmas advertising should be restricted by legislation to advent.
attributes.additional_details: Yesterday (14/08/18) I saw Santa toys for sale in Poundland. Other people have reported products in Tesco. This world is hard enough for todays children without depriving them of the one magical period each year to look forward to, without making them bored of Christmas songs by mid November. I accept businesses need to plan in advance for such a profitable period but the public face of Christmas should be reserved until advent.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Lower the speed limit on the A419, also put cameras on the road
attributes.background: I was involved in a serious car accident on the A419 that wasnt my fault. This was due to the speed in which the car behind me was driving, and did not have time to react. On this night 3 accidents, including mine happened. Accidents happen on this road daily and i think something needs to happen.
attributes.additional_details: You can see evidence on the Wiltshire Police accident. They are called out to accidents daily on the A419 I am sure they are tired of this.

attributes.action: Clarify the criteria for Secure Accommodation that is used by Local Authorities.
attributes.background: Secure accommodation should be used as a last resort and the Government should make this clear to Local Authorities in its guidance.

attributes.action: Instant disqualification for drivers under the influence of drink or drugs.
attributes.background:
Driving whilst under the influence of drugs has become more prolific than drink driving in the UK. 
An instant roadside disqualification for any driver who fails the tests or fails to provide a specimen for testing would make our roads safer before they have their day in court.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment anyone caught driving under the influence of drink or drugs are free to get back in a vehicle and drive until they are disqualified by Magistrates. Due to the time it takes for blood or urine tests results, scheduling a court date and other factors.
This places the public at undue risk.
A roadside disqualification pending results or court date would eliminate that risk.
I understand "innocent until proven guilty" but a drug swipe is pass or fail the only mitigation is by how much.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into the deaths at Gosport Memorial Hospital
attributes.background: The Gosport Independent Panel found over 450 lives were shortened due to the pattern of prescribing and administering of opioids. This deserves a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: BBC Panorama also investigated this.

attributes.action: Introduce Mandatory Random Drug Testing for ALL UK Police on a quarterly basis.
attributes.background: The police should be subject to random drug testing at least every quarter.

attributes.action: Free up empty MOD housing stock to homeless ex services staff .
attributes.background:
MOD homes standing empty across UK. 
More than 11,000 Ministry of Defence homes across the UK are empty, costing the taxpayer more than Â£25m a year in rent and maintenance.
These homes could be used to accommodate homeless ex service staff.

attributes.action: Hold an immediate independence referendum for Scotland (Indy Ref 2)
attributes.background: In light of recent events we would like an immediate second vote to decide whether Scotland leaves the UK
attributes.additional_details: Future, freedom, fearless

attributes.action: Make all foreign lorry/hgv drivers carry insurance cards
attributes.background: To enter the uk, all lorry hgv drivers must carry a insurance card for the hgv they are driving, or a valid card from their employers, incase of a accident or incident, the card would have employment address and insurance details on, drive without one should fine the driver and take the hgv away
attributes.additional_details:
I was involved in a accident and it took the police 45 mins to get his details and his insurance how would the public who are shaken up get that information 
Even the police said good luck 
So a card with insurance address, policy number, name of the employer

attributes.action: Make mental health education compulsory in high schools
attributes.background: I did a survey of 250 teenage girls re:their mental health and found that over half of the factors that contributed to their mental health issues stemmed from school environment. to me, this indicates that compulsory PSHE lessons on wellbeing, seeking help and general mental health should be taught.
attributes.additional_details:
a blog post examing my survey - jessrigg.com 
https://www.bmj.com/content/361/bmj.k2608 
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/what-we-do/our-work/young-peoples-mental-health

attributes.action: Fund more research into Endometriosis
attributes.background: Endometriosis is the name given to the condition where cells like the ones in the lining of the womb (uterus) are found elsewhere in the body. The actual cause of endometriosis is unknown. Around 1.5 million women in the UK are currently living with the condition.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis.
 
Endometriosis is the second most common gynaecological condition in the UK.
 
Endometriosis affects 1.5 million women, a similar number of women affected by diabetes.
 
On average it takes 7.5 years from onset of symptoms to get a diagnosis.
 
Endometriosis costs the UK economy Â£8.2bn a year in treatment, loss of work and healthcare costs.
 
https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/information

attributes.action: Introduce a climate change levy on beef and dairy products
attributes.background:
The livestock sector has overshot safe limits and in particular dairy and beef production have been identified as major contributors to climate change and biodiversity loss.

Also over-consumption of these products is a fact of our unhealthy lifestyles, giving us obesity and coronary heart disease
attributes.additional_details:
A levy on these products will increase Treasury funds whilst making us more healthy whilst helping us achieve emissions targets. A win-win situation, that might also yield a reduction in the burden on the NHS similar to that brought about by reduction in smoking.

Tax receipts could be used incentivise livestock farmers to turn foresters, turning their land over for reforestation which would improve biodiversity and local air quality and allow our countryside to return to its natural state.

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation â very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: Make online retailers disclose the courier company that they use on website
attributes.background: With a varying degree of service provided by differing courier companies and not knowing which company will be (or not) delivering your goods, it should be compulsory for all online retailers to disclose which company they are using, prior to checkout on the website.
attributes.additional_details: Knowing which courier company has been engaged stops the lottery of will they or won't they deliver. In rural areas we know which companies are reliable and which ones don't bother at all, however, when we order we are then subject to the lottery of will goods turn up or not. This will ensure that we can have an informed choice as to whether to proceed with the purchase or not before committing to it.

attributes.action: Illegal for children under the age of 16 to purchase eggs
attributes.background: Following the recent devastating incidents and criminal damage that has been caused not only in my area but around the country with children throwing eggs at cars, houses and shops has created a big upset.
attributes.additional_details: A young boy has been left critically injured, after a group of children had thrown an egg, from the opposite side of the road, at a cars front windscreen which led the driver to not be able to see where they were going and innocently hitting a young boy, who was trick or treating with his friends, this has left him with a bleed to his brain and not knowing who his mum and other family members were. Just imagine the upset that the family is going through. I pray that Brendan has a speedy recovery

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: Ban perpetrators of domestic violence representing themselves in family court
attributes.background: In domestic abuse cases in family court, the abuser continues to abuse and control their victim by choosing to self-represent. This is a way for them to obtain personal information i.e. medical records about their victim.
attributes.additional_details: Womenâs aid are aware of the perpetrators motives and are in agreement the way family courts are run needs to change. Women are losing their children due to domestic abuse even when they leave the abuser the abuse still continues. The abuser uses the family court to obtain personal information on their victim by self-representing. This needs to be stopped. The criminal courts have put this in place so why not the civil courts? Women are being put through massive amount of stress during these proceedings when the protection can be put there! Cafcass also need in-depth training on domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Remove multiple minor convictions from DBS from over 10 years ago
attributes.background: If someone has more than one minor offence from over 10 years ago, they still appear on the DBS Disclosure and Barring Service. People are refused jobs as a result, even though thereâs nothing serious on there. This means that they unfairly continue to suffer for stupid mistakes made when young.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be an order so that multiple convictions can be removed after 10 years. The major ones should stay on for life, for example, if anyone is on the sex register, someone who has been and are still in prison etc.
 
Convictions staying on of you have more than one is crazy when itâs been over 10 years.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the Membership of NATO.
attributes.background: The British public should have an opportunity to determine whether the country should play a role in the future in the The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
attributes.additional_details: NATO was founded in 1949 by the United States as a military alliance between western nations to oppose the Soviet Union and serve a purpose in defending the west against the eastern block. However, today NATO is now a cold war relic. Britain should take control over its military affairs and its foreign policy to prevent the country from getting involved in wars.  We should follow our own operations rather than following NATO.

attributes.action: Protection for WW2 RN wrecks that are being blown up & the sailors desecrated
attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below
https://www.theguardian.com/world/ng-interactive/2017/nov/03/worlds-biggest-grave-robbery-asias-disappearing-ww2-shipwrecks

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Cyclists to take a road safety test and be registered to use the road
attributes.background: Cyclists to take a safety and road awareness course and have to be registered with a number on their backs the same as car drivers  Many cyclists donât know basic road safety rules and cut up drivers and donât give way etc etc. Itâs all due to lack of awareness, itâs so dangerous.

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for Group B Strep
attributes.background: Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus are common infections. However, in rare cases they can be fatal for the unborn baby, and for up until 12 weeks after a baby is born if they develop a late onset of symptoms. Both of these infections are easily treated by antibiotics.
attributes.additional_details: Antibiotics are given during the motherâs labour and antibiotics are given to baby once born. These infections are easily picked up by a swab and are easily treated also. This should be a routine test that ALL pregnant women should be able to get during pregnancy to ensure the health and safety of both mum and baby.

attributes.action: Acid attacks in the UK are at a rise, the Government should deter these attacks.
attributes.background: Acid attacks are at a rise within the United Kingdom, not enough is being done to deter these threats and violent crimes, therefore we are suggesting for the Government and Policing Services to validate the following: tougher prison sentences, tougher laws for purchase, increased education/research.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the Government should implement:

- Tougher laws and Prison Sentences with a minimum of 18 years and maximum of 60
- ID will be needed to purchase chemicals
- Tax will be added to chemical purchases
- Chemicals over 30% will need a 'special ID' which is not handed to 
convicted individual(s)
- Education and research is increased
- Purchases should only be allowed to be made digitally by Credit Card for Police print
- Information of chemical purchases should be handled to the Police

attributes.action: Extend article 50 and call for a 'Citizen's Assembly' to resolve Brexit crisis
attributes.background: The Brexit debate has caused a deep societal divide in Britain which cannot be resolved by either pushing a 'no deal', 'no Brexit' or Teresa May's failed deal. A Citizen's Assembly, rather than a divisive second referendum, can heal this divide, but this needs time.
attributes.additional_details:
The time has come that the decision is given back to the people, not by a divisive second referendum but a healing, and unifying Citizen's Assembly.
A Citizen's Assembly worked very well in Ireland to heal the divide over abortion.

attributes.action: Refurbish immigration and trade ports for WTO brexit
attributes.background: The Government needs to invest in refurbishing immigration and trade facilities at ports for a WTO Brexit.

attributes.action: UK government to urge the Japanese government to stop the mutilation of dolphins
attributes.background: The Japanese fishermen cut the fins of dolphins that they catch in their nets and then release them back into the sea to die a slow and agonising death

attributes.action: Fund free transport for 16-22 year olds.
attributes.background: Transport for students is very expensive and in rural areas, it is too expensive to get to college or school. This potentially stops people from doing jobs that they want to do because they can't get there.

attributes.action: Give women 2 paid days off a month when needed during their time of the month.
attributes.background: Menstruation is bleeding that occurs when the uterus sheds its lining. Periods usually last from 2-7 days and can be light/heavy. Along with that women experience other symptoms such as back, neck and headaches, nausea, and diarrhea. Most women have to endure this whilst working and it's not right.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally more symptoms are migraines, stomachaches, and vomiting. Up to 20% of women experience extreme cramps at the onset of a period â a condition called dysmenorrhea. These cramps cause immense discomfort and pain, experiencing this at work affects productivity. Many women don't take sick days as it's something they know will come and simply cannot avoid unlike viral or bacterial illnesses almost all people experience. Other countries have adopted this and the UK should rightly follow suit.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on whether to give or not give foreign aid.
attributes.background: If 80% of voters in this referendum are in favour of NOT giving foreign aid, then foreign aid should be reduced by 80%, with similar action for any result.
attributes.additional_details: A great number of people are sickened and disgusted at a) The amount given away in Foreign Aid, and b) when that aid is given to unsuitable recipients. Foreign Aid should therefore be dependant on voters allowing it to be made by voting for it.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership/dog microchip details operate like car ownership.
attributes.background: Many people will have seen the cctv footage of a dog being abandoned on the side of a road in Trentham on 17/12/2018. The dog apparently had two previous owners but microchip details were not available of the current owner.
attributes.additional_details: It is a legal requirement in the UK that dogs of 8 weeks or over are microchipped and the details are updated but this clearly is not working with many dogs being identified with no updated microchip information. The government should make dog ownership similar to car ownership and V5C documentation. Therefore if you sold or transferred ownership to someone else it is the current owners responsibility to check and collect proof of name and address and send details to the microchip company.

attributes.action: Allow teaching of Quran to Muslim kids as part of required RE in primary schools
attributes.background: All Muslim kids going to Mosque after school for Quran reading. They are too tired every day after studying at two institutes school and Mosque.
attributes.additional_details: We have to make both possible at one place in the best interest of kids. The law should change so Muslim children can learn the Quran at primary schools.

attributes.action: Make it compulsary to put food miles on packaging
attributes.background: When I was shopping I saw that English potatoes cost 10p more than egyptian ones. It then occurred to me the distance they had travelled (probably by air) and thought for 10p I can reduce the pollution created by importing goods. If food miles on packaging we can all make informed decisions.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable cigarette filters in the UK.
attributes.background: Cigarette butts are the most common form of man-made litter in the world. It is estimated that 4.5 trillion cigarette butts become litter every year. The fibres used as the predominant filter material do not readily biodegrade. A normal lifespan of a discarded filter is thought to be up to 15 years!
attributes.additional_details: Banning the sale of certain materials is an effective way to force manufacturers to create alternatives. Fines have not stopped individuals from littering (just look at the floor on your own high-street!). Manufacturers won't change from cheaper, more environmentally damaging materials unless their hand is forced. So, let's force their hands!

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher GCSE papers and have the same paper for everyone.
attributes.background: We feel as though we are being set up for failure as we are not even able to achieve a 6 in a foundation paper when we know we could achieve higher than a 4/5
attributes.additional_details: we think itâs unequal and not fair that other students get a higher opportunity of success therefor we know we probably would not be able to do so well in the higher paper so we believe the test should include foundation and higher paper questions combined into one science and maths should be the same so that everyone has the same chance.

attributes.action: Sanitary products must become free of charge to all young women 18 or under.
attributes.background: Girls and young women are struggling to buy sanitary products for themselves which leaves them a unpleasant experience during their period. There are many young women living in poverty who can't provide for themselves so receiving free sanitary products would be beneficial.

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and itâs taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.

attributes.action: Change divorce law to protect assets (financial settlement)
attributes.background: You marry a person, not their bank account/assets. When you divorce your money should stay with you and NOT be split 50:50 as a starting point. No-one ever marries with a 50:50 input so the divorce should let you keep what's yours. Only exception: Kids should be cared for equally by both parties.
attributes.additional_details: The law should change to help hard working people keep what's theirs to begin with!! Please sign the petition and drive this change!

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up toÂ 1000 yearsÂ to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 yearsÂ to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes ofÂ plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Pull out from and cut all UK taxpayer funding to the UN Human Rights Council
attributes.background: The Council has clearly become a platform for countries with worst rights records to whitewash themselves, as evidenced by the lack of a single resolution on the countries that run it. It is therefore a moral obligation to stop legitimising this travesty.
attributes.additional_details: According to its mission statement, UN HRC is "responsible for strengthening the promotion and protection of human rights around the globe and for addressing situations of human rights violations." It is also empowered to investigate alleged human rights abuses of UN member states. The watchdog's makeup includes Venezuela, China, Qatar, Angola, Pakistan, DR Congo, Cuba, Afghanistan and Saudi Arabia, with Somalia, Bangladesh and Eritrea most recently joining the rest.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Require retailers to disclose the factories in which their products are made
attributes.background: With the fashion industry being the second biggest polluter in the world - we need to hold our high street brands to account. These companies contract out the production of their clothes to factories in third world countries. Sign this to pressure companies into providing full disclosure.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. Weâre asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school donât add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. Itâs a choice people have.

attributes.action: Zero VAT on low sugar snacks for kids/adults <5g/100g.
attributes.background:
The UK is full of high sugar snacks and is suffering an Obesity epidemic- why are VAT Free Junk foods are allowed?
High sugar treats must be VAT rated. VAT should be zero rated for healthy snacks for children/adults  eg. roasted nuts, raisins, frozen yoghurt, protein bars and diabetic chocolate.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 kids are obese by the time they leave primary school! This leads to more issues, e.g. low self-esteem, health/welfare issues.
1 in 13 deaths relate to obesity
Who Is Obese in the UK?
66% Adults
25% 2-10 year olds
33% 11-15 year olds

The NHS in England spent Â£6.1 billion on overweight and obesity-related ill-health in 2014 to 15. We spend more each year on the treatment of obesity and diabetes than we do on the police, fire service and judicial system combined.The overall cost of obesity to the wider society is estimated at Â£27 billion.
https://publichealthmatters.blog.gov.uk/2017/03/31/health-matters-obesity-and-the-food-environment/

The VAT free status on any high sugary foods/ snacks/ treats has to stop. 
VAT on healthy foods has to be made VAT free.
